snippet.title: Orbital changes warmed the Earth's interglacial periods
snippet.description: ...Scientists think they have a pretty good idea of how orbital variations drive the glacial cycles that have dominated Earth's recent history. Periodic changes in the Earth's rotational tilt and orientation, called Milankovitch cycles, alter how sunlight gets distributed over the planet's surface, driving the advance and retreat of ice sheets. But some of the details of how this syst...
